description: An integrated language service for Typst

tinymist.compileStatus.description: In VSCode, enable compile status meaning that the extension will show the compilation status in the status bar. Since Neovim and Helix don't have a such feature, it is disabled by default at the language server label.
tinymist.compileStatus.title: Show/Report compilation status

tinymist.dragAndDrop.description: Whether to handle drag-and-drop of resources into the editing typst document. Note: restarting the editor is required to change this setting.
tinymist.dragAndDrop.title: Drag and drop

tinymist.exportPdf.description: The extension can export PDFs of your Typst files. This setting controls whether this feature is enabled and how often it runs.
enumDescriptions: Never export PDFs, you will manually run typst.
Export PDFs when you save a file.
Export PDFs as you type in a file.
Export PDFs when a document has a title (and save a file), which is useful to filter out template files.
tinymist.exportPdf.title: Export PDF

tinymist.fontPaths.description: A list of file or directory path to fonts. Note: The configuration source in higher priority will **override** the configuration source in lower priority. The order of precedence is: Configuration `tinymist.fontPaths` > Configuration `tinymist.typstExtraArgs.fontPaths` > LSP's CLI Argument `--font-path` > The environment variable `TYPST_FONT_PATHS` (a path list separated by `;` (on Windows) or `:` (Otherwise)). Note: If the path to fonts is a relative path, it will be resolved based on the root directory. Note: In VSCode, you can use VSCode variables in the path, e.g. `${workspaceFolder}/fonts`.
tinymist.fontPaths.title: Font paths for Typst compiler

tinymist.formatterMode.description: The extension can format Typst files using typstfmt or typstyle.
enumDescriptions: Formatter is not activated.
Use typstyle formatter.
Use typstfmt formatter.
tinymist.formatterMode.title: Enable Experimental Formatter

tinymist.formatterPrintWidth.description: Set the print width for the formatter, which is a **soft limit** of characters per line. See [the definition of *Print Width*](https://prettier.io/docs/en/options.html#print-width). Note: this has lower priority than the formatter's specific configurations.
tinymist.formatterPrintWidth.title: Set formatter's (unsigned) print width

tinymist.onEnterEvent.description: Enable or disable [experimental/onEnter](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer/blob/master/docs/dev/lsp-extensions.md#on-enter) (LSP onEnter feature) to allow automatic insertion of characters on enter, such as `///` for comments. Note: restarting the editor is required to change this setting.
tinymist.onEnterEvent.title: Handling on enter events

tinymist.outputPath.description: The path pattern to store Typst artifacts, you can use `$root` or `$dir` or `$name` to do magic configuration, e.g. `$dir/$name` (default) and `$root/target/$dir/$name`.
tinymist.outputPath.title: Output path

tinymist.preview.cursorIndicator.description: (Experimental) Show typst cursor indicator in preview.

tinymist.preview.fontPaths.description: List of *additional* paths to font assets used by typst-preview.

items.description: Absolute path to a directory or file containing font assets.
items.title: Font path

tinymist.preview.fontPaths.markdownDeprecationMessage: The configuration item is ignored. Please use `tinymist.fontPaths` instead.

anyOf.description: Specify a strategy for all elements in the preview.
enumDescriptions: Disable color inversion of the preview
Invert colors smartly by detecting dark/light themes in browser environment or by `typst query` your document
Always invert colors of the preview

anyOf.description: Specify strategies for each element kind

image.description: Specify a strategy for images in the preview
enumDescriptions: Disable color inversion of the preview
Invert colors smartly by detecting dark/light themes in browser environment or by `typst query` your document
Always invert colors of the preview

rest.description: Specify a strategy for rest elements in the preview
enumDescriptions: Disable color inversion of the preview
Invert colors smartly by detecting dark/light themes in browser environment or by `typst query` your document
Always invert colors of the preview

tinymist.preview.invertColors.description: Invert colors of the preview (useful for dark themes without cost). Please note you could see the origin colors when you hover elements in the preview. It is also possible to specify strategy to each element kind by an object map in JSON format.

tinymist.preview.partialRendering.description: Only render visible part of the document. This can improve performance but still being experimental.

tinymist.preview.pinPreviewFile.description: Declare current previewing file as entrypoint for typst-lsp or tinymist. This will make typst-lsp or tinymist to use this file as entrypoint instead of the file opened in vscode. This can improve diagnostics messages and auto completion but still being experimental.
tinymist.preview.pinPreviewFile.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated and no longer needed. The extension will always pin the previewed file as the entrypoint for the language server.

tinymist.preview.refresh.description: Refresh preview when the document is saved or when the document is changed
enumDescriptions: Refresh preview on save
Refresh preview on type
tinymist.preview.refresh.title: Refresh preview

enumDescriptions: Disable automatic scroll sync
Scroll preview to current cursor position when selection changes by mouse
Scroll preview to current cursor position when selection changes by mouse or keyboard (any source)

tinymist.preview.sysInputs.description: key-value pairs visible through `sys.inputs`, corresponds to `--input` argument of typst cli
tinymist.preview.sysInputs.markdownDeprecationMessage: The configuration item is ignored. Please see `tinymist.typstExtraArgs` for inputs.

tinymist.preview.systemFonts.description: Whether to load system fonts. If disabled, only fonts in `typst-preview.fontPaths` is loaded
tinymist.preview.systemFonts.markdownDeprecationMessage: The configuration item is ignored. Please use `tinymist.systemFonts` instead.

tinymist.previewFeature.description: Enable or disable preview features of Typst. Note: restarting the editor is required to change this setting.
tinymist.previewFeature.title: Enable preview features

tinymist.renderDocs.description: (Experimental) Whether to render typst elements in (hover) docs. In VS Code, when this feature is enabled, tinymist will store rendered results in the filesystem's temporary storage to show them in the hover content. Note: Please disable this feature if the editor doesn't support/handle image previewing in docs.
tinymist.renderDocs.title: (Experimental) Render Docs

tinymist.rootPath.markdownDescription: Configure the root for absolute paths in typst. Hint: you can set the rootPath to `-`, so that tinymist will always use parent directory of the file as the root path. Note: for neovim users, if it complains root not found, you must set `require("lspconfig")["tinymist"].setup { root_dir }` as well, see [tinymist#528](https://github.com/Myriad-Dreamin/tinymist/issues/528).
tinymist.rootPath.title: Root path

tinymist.semanticTokens.description: Enable or disable semantic tokens (LSP syntax highlighting)
enumDescriptions: Use semantic tokens for syntax highlighting
Do not use semantic tokens for syntax highlighting
tinymist.semanticTokens.title: Semantic tokens mode

tinymist.serverPath.description: The extension can use a local tinymist executable instead of the one bundled with the extension. This setting controls the path to the executable.
tinymist.serverPath.title: Path to server executable

enumDescriptions: Show the exported files in editor tabs.
Show the exported files by system default application.

tinymist.showExportFileIn.description: Configures way of opening exported files, e.g. inside of editor tabs or using system application.
tinymist.showExportFileIn.title: (Experimental) Show Exported Files in Some Place

tinymist.systemFonts.description: A flag that determines whether to load system fonts for Typst compiler, which is useful for ensuring reproducible compilation. If set to null or not set, the extension will use the default behavior of the Typst compiler. Note: You need to restart LSP to change this options.
tinymist.systemFonts.title: Whether to load system fonts for Typst compiler

tinymist.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the language server.

tinymist.typingContinueCommentsOnNewline.markdownDescription: Whether to prefix newlines after comments with the corresponding comment prefix.
tinymist.typingContinueCommentsOnNewline.title: Continue Comments on Newline

tinymist.typstExtraArgs.description: You can pass any arguments as you like, and we will try to follow behaviors of the **same version** of typst-cli. Note: the arguments may be overridden by other settings. For example, `--font-path` will be overridden by `tinymist.fontPaths`.

items.description: The arguments for Typst as same as typst-cli.
items.title: arguments in order

tinymist.typstExtraArgs.title: Specifies the arguments for Typst as same as typst-cli
